main.description: A hypercert record tracking impact work.

shortDescription.description: Short blurb of the impact work done.

description.description: Optional longer description of the impact work done.

image.description: The hypercert visual representation as a URI or image blob.

contributions.description: A strong reference to the contributions done to create the impact in the hypercerts. The record referenced must conform with the lexicon org.hypercerts.claim.contribution.

rights.description: A strong reference to the rights that this hypercert has. The record referenced must conform with the lexicon org.hypercerts.claim.rights.

location.description: A strong reference to the location where the activity was performed. The record referenced must conform with the lexicon app.certified.location.

project.description: A reference (AT-URI) to the project record that this activity is part of. The record referenced must conform with the lexicon org.hypercerts.claim.project. This activity must also be referenced by the project, establishing a bidirectional link.

createdAt.description: Client-declared timestamp when this record was originally created

workScope.description: Logical scope of the work using label-based conditions. All labels in `withinAllOf` must apply; at least one label in `withinAnyOf` must apply if provided; no label in `withinNoneOf` may apply.

withinAllOf.description: Labels that MUST all hold for the scope to apply.

withinAnyOf.description: Labels of which AT LEAST ONE must hold (optional). If omitted or empty, imposes no additional condition.

withinNoneOf.description: Labels that MUST NOT hold for the scope to apply.

activity.description: A strong reference to a hypercert activity record. This activity must conform to the lexicon org.hypercerts.claim.activity

weight.description: The relative weight/importance of this hypercert activity (stored as a string to avoid float precision issues). Weights can be any positive numeric values and do not need to sum to a specific total; normalization can be performed by the consuming application as needed.
